What Is The Difference Among Best Tether Gambling Sites?

Finding out which casino is the best requires a bit of digging, but what can help you the most is knowing exactly what you are looking for.

The majority of players who try out at least a few casinos mostly tend to end up with the same requirements: best Tether casinos must be safe, easy to use, fast and responsive, have a good support and a good reputation especially regarding payouts. These are the main things that set casinos apart.

Which leads us to what’s the difference among best Tether gambling sites. When it comes to safety, the first thing to look at is the casino’s licence. The most common is the Curacao licence. Every licence has it’s own pros and cons, I’m not going to go into details about them here but this is the first thing which can set casinos apart because it defines the regulatory body which oversees a casino and consequently also it’s safety. You can find each casino’s licence written in the casino’s review.

Other safety issues mostly arise with payment processes or games which aren’t controlled by the casino but rather by the payment provider and game provider. All game providers a casino offers are written in the casino’s review.

Each review has a section about user experience, where I comment on the site, how it looks, whether it’s easy to use, how fast it is and so on. Where I can I give you exact numbers about loading times and response times.

What kind of support a casino offers is shown in the list above. Most casinos now offer live chat, because it’s the easiest and fastest (and free) communication method. Some then also have an e-mail support and some even a phone option. Actually calling by phone is the fastest way but it certainly isn’t cheap since you’re most likely calling abroad.

How good the casino’s support is and how fast is a payout is difficult to say. I could write my own experience with a casino but I’m just one in a million players where each has his own experience so I rather wrote my experience as I was doing a video review of a casino if I had enough information.

My best suggestion when deciding for a new casino is to pick a few different casinos, make a small deposit in each, use a bonus and play. If you’re picky or want to be 100 % sure then that’s the only way to know for sure.

Some players, however, emphasise other things such as how generous a Tether casino bonus is, wagering requirements, how many games they offer and so on. If you belong in this group of players than I suggest you continue reading about the best Tether casino bonus and look for the details in the list below or perhaps pick a Tether casino no deposit bonus to avoid a deposit until you’re sure about your choice of the best Tether casinos.

Tether Casino Bonuses Explained

A Tether casino bonus always consists of 3 main ingredients: a percentage (%), an amount, and (optionally) an amount of free spins.

The percentage tells you how much of your deposit will be added to your playing funds. For example: If you deposit 100 USDT, a 50 % bonus means that you will be getting 50 USDT on top of the initial 100 USDT, adding up to 150 USDT in total.

Bonus amount is the maximum amount that you can get in the form of bonus money. For example: a 100 % up to 100 USDT bonus means that you can get 100 USDT if you deposit 100 USDT. But you cannot get more than this; if you deposit 150 USDT, you still get 100 USDT in this case.

Free spins are spins of slot reels which you do not have to bet your own money on. Casinos usually have a dedicated game where you can use these free spins, as well as a set bet amount for the free spins. Free spins winnings are also limited.

Each Tether casino bonus has a wagering requirement that tells you how many times you must wager (or bet) the bonus money before you can withdraw your winnings. For example: If you have 100 USDT bonus money, a 40x wagering requirement means that you must wager 100×40 USDT (= 4,000 USDT) before the bonus money and the winnings resulting from the bonus money are yours.

Good to know: not all games count equally towards wagering contribution. Slots always count 100 %, so each USDT wagered counts in its full value. However, every casino has a list of slots which do not contribute at all – so make sure that you are playing the right one before you start! Table games usually contribute 50 % or 0 %, and live games and other games usually do not contribute. A 50 % contribution means that every USDT that you bet contributes only 0.5 USDT in the wagering requirement that you need in order to withdraw the bonus money.

Each bonus is also accompanied by a minimum deposit which tells you what the minimum amount that you must deposit to be eligible for the bonus is.

Wait – What if I don’t want to deposit any money? In this case, what you need are no deposit bonuses. These usually come in the form of free spins, and you can play without depositing – but do keep in mind that in order to withdraw any winnings from free spins a deposit is usually required.

Advantages Of Betting With Tether

There are a lot of advantages of gambling with any cryptocurrency – you can read more about this in the Why gamble with Tether section – but Tether betting sites have their own special features on top of that.

Cryptocurrency transactions are known for their speed which can certainly give you an edge when placing bets at the last seconds or when making live bets while the game is already happening. During live bets or In-play betting the odds are changing more rapidly; timing is crucial and Tether is the perfect candidate to turn the odds in your favor. If your football game is half way through and you want to bet on how the rest of the play will and, you can do that with Tether.

Due to low transaction costs Tether betting sites can afford to provide you with better odds if you bet with Tether. To me, this reason alone sounds good enough. 🙂

Tether betting sites offer just as many sports as any regular betting site. You can find all the major ones such as Soccer, Tennis, Basketball, Baseball, American Football, Ice Hockey, and tons of other sports as well.

You also have the option to bet on all major leagues like the English Premier League, Serie A and all the rest. Even some smaller leagues are supported if you wish to test your luck more ‘locally.’

Some betting sites will include virtual sports too, and even offer betting on politics such as election results and who wins!
The options are basically endless.

If you are a computer game or video game fan, you also have the option to bet on your favorite game. Such events are known as eSports.

Different Tether Slots Types

Slots in their essence are very simple: You spin the reels, and if you get matching symbols on all reels, you win. But different slots offer many different specifics which allow for additional options and betting. You have everything from 3 to 6 or more reels, to betting on one or a few ten pay lines in all possible shapes across reels.

Perhaps the most searched for subsection of Tether slots are the progressive or jackpot Tether slots. These are the ones that have huge jackpots, ranging up to a few 100,000 USDT or even a few million USDT. One thing to keep in mind is that progressive slots are usually not allowed when playing with bonus money.

The so-called bonus Tether slots have bonus rounds or bonus games integrated into the slot game itself. Bonus games can come in forms of free spins, puzzles, or completely unique and almost stand-alone games, all of which allow you to win much more than during the regular part of the game.

Small bet limit Tether slots are the kind of slots where you can bet really small amounts if your objective is to not spend a lot of money. The game is the same, but as bets go low so do the winnings.

Lastly, we have themed Tether slots. These come in all different shapes and varieties: movie slots, fruit slots, cartoon slots and more. They are essentially regular slots, thematically embellished with your favorite characters to make things more attractive.

Tether Roulette Styles

Basic roulette styles are European, American and French roulette. The game remains essentially the same in each variant, but the appearance or betting options are a bit different.

European and French roulette both have 36 numbers and one zero. French roulette has some additional options which allow you to reduce the house edge a bit, if you know how to use them.

American roulette has 36 numbers and two zeros which makes its house edge a bit higher.

To learn more about roulette types and their differences, you will find a detailed explanation in the roulette guide about roulette types.

Frequently Asked Questions About Tether?

I answer some of the most frequently asked questions about Tether here. If visuals appeal to you, I invite you to check my Tether infographic to learn more about Tether.

Tether is an online currency based on regular fiat currency. It belongs to the stablecoins category of cryptocurrency.

Tether was launched in 2014 and the idea behind it is that it would combine the best of both worlds: real, fiat money, plus the benefits on cryptocurrency transparency, fast transactions and low fees.

Tether uses blockchain technology to store, send and receive digital tokens. Its value is fixed to US Dollar, Euro or offshore Chinese Yuan. 1 USDT = 1 USD. It is backed by reserve, which means that the sum of all Tether in circulation equals or is less than the value of the reserve.

Because Tether is ‘tethered’ to fiat currency it is not affected by volatility. Its value compared to fiat currency is always 1:1.

You can use Tether for online trading like any other cryptocurrency, but aside from this you need to exchange it back into regular USD to use it.

For this very reason, since online casinos began accepting Tether, gambling with Tether online is a good way to use it or to implement it. All of the best Tether casinos or Tether betting sites on this page accept Tether and most of them offer bonuses in USDT as in any other cryptocurrency.

Tether combines best of both worlds, crypto and fiat. It has the same benefits as other cryptocurrencies:

  1. Privacy: Most casinos will ask only for your email and your e-wallet address when you register, play and withdraw winnings, so all your personal information remains private.
  2. Transaction speed is almost instant compared to credit card transactions or wire transfers. Deposits take mere seconds to appear on your account. Withdrawals do take a bit longer, which differs from casino to casino and their confirmation process, but for smaller amounts it should always be no more than a matter of hours at most.
  3. Low transaction fees: Compared to transaction fees that banks or credit card companies charge cryptocurrency transaction fees are negligible. Some casinos even pay these fees for you.
  4. Better betting odds: Tether betting sites can improve your odds when you bet with crypto, due to lower transaction fees – the bookmakers have lower fees as well.
  5. Provably fair games: More and more games offered by crypto casinos operate on blockchain technology, which means that their fairness can be proven due to the transparency of the blockchain. You can read more about provably fair games on the ‘how to’ page.
  6. Security: If you choose an adequately strong password at sign-up and choose a good e-wallet, you will be safe. No one has your personal information and if you make sure that you play at trustworthy casinos, you should never have any problems. All of the best Tether casinos listed on this page have proven themselves worthy and have earned a good reputation over the years.
  7. Some people argue that gambling with cryptocurrency can be risky because the value of a currency can decrease while you are playing or even while you are waiting for your withdrawal. But this is not the case with Tether because its value is tied to the USD and therefore cannot be affected by the general volatility of crypto; Tether’s value remains the same.

Perhaps the only thing that you might worry about (although probably not) is the ‘user non-friendliness’ of dealing with crypto, e-wallets, and so on. I used the quotation marks since this is a very relative term and I imagine that someone who has crypto and decides to either trade or gamble with it is familiar enough with the digital process around it, and will not have problems with the technology related to it.

  1. Decentralization: Tether is a centralized cryptocurrency where one single entity issues all the coins (Tether Limited). This means that users must trust this entity, the single point of potential failure, with their money. The company is not very transparent with the minting process of Tether and has been caught lying about the one-to-one backing of Tether by the US Dollar.
  2. Safety: While Tether is a secure cryptocurrency technologically speaking, its biggest risks are financial, legal, and those pertaining to security and censorship. The company in charge of Tether has not had consistent banking relationships throughout its lifetime, as is limited in some areas, including the US. While Tether was said to be backed by the dollar, this has been disproved as 75 % of Tether is backed by cash and cash alternatives, with only about 4 % of it backed by actual cash. Tether also has a history of blacklisting addresses, freezing funds and complying with regulatory pressures, which poses remarkable censorship risks. Many addresses have been blacklisted, rendering their funds completely unusable.
  3. Scalability: Tether has been scaling spectacularly, overtaking Bitcoin with its 7-day average adjusted transfer value, becoming the leader in the cryptocurrency space. It is the most popular stablecoin and is especially popular in Asia. With its listing on Coinbase, it also gained important value in the western world. As it can be used on many blockchains, the rising fees on Ethereum are not a long-term issue.

Tether is one of the most popular stablecoins, so all major crypto exchanges offer it. I am currently not endorsing any specific exchange (yet), but you should not have problems finding a good one by browsing on google.

Tether tokens exist on 3 different blockchains: Bitcoin Omni layer, Ethereum and Tron. Tether is the same on all of them, but when depositing Tether, you must pay attention to which protocol you select, based on the destination address.

The simplest way to identify which protocol to use is to look at the beginning of the destination address:
– If it begins with ‘1,’ ‘3,’ or ‘bc1″‘ it is using the Bitcoin Omni layer.
– If it begins with ‘0x,’ it is using Ethereum.
– If it begins with ‘TX,’ it’s using TRON.

Once you have chosen your desired casino and registered, you will find the casino’s e-wallet address in the deposit section. Copy the address to your e-wallet, check the correct blockchain protocol, type in the desired Tether amount and send it.

Now you can choose your game and have fun!

Withdrawal of Tether is done in a very similar way, except that you copy your own e-wallet address and paste it in the casino’s withdrawal section.

This question is a bit harder to answer because we must first establish what a Tether game is. ‘Tether game’ is a phrase describing any game which can be played using Tether. Among all these games some run on blockchain technology and some do not. The first group are provably fair and the latter are not. Since there are millions of different games out there there is no way to explain which are which, but you can look at the provably fair casinos category to see which casinos CERTAINLY have at least some provably fair games.

There have been accusations and fears that Tether is not fully backed by the reserve and that its true value is not 1:1 with USD anymore.

You can come across accusations that Tether has been printing tokens out of thin air in order to manipulate the Bitcoin market.

The whole story revolves around many different companies and organizations, but in the end it all comes down to the relationship between Tether and Bitfinex (a cryptocurrency exchange). They are two separate companies, but are managed by a lot of the same people. In 2019 Tether was investigated by the Attorney General of New York. They found out that Tether was no longer fully backed due to 851 million USD being rendered inaccessible. This was the amount that Tether loaned to Bitfinex to help them fill a hole created by the same amount, which was held by a third-party payment provider and seized by several authorities in different countries.

Long story short, Tether confirmed that they were only 74 % backed. To return things back to the way they were, Bitfinex started selling an exchange token LEO and using part of the ICO to repay Tether.

Today it is safe to say that Tether is more than 74 % backed, but less than 100 %. However, the cryptocurrency markets appear to trust Tether, traders still value Tether at 1 USD, and Tether remains one of the strongest stablecoins.
